storyInfo: The producer Greta Stone insists that Dalton's death was an accident, but the coordinator Shelly believes it is linked to an incident five years ago. Lucian is reminded of a lesson that the Troupe Leader gave him when he was young.

attributes.content: We've concluded that Dalton's death was an accident.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: The medical team is taking his body back to central Wrankwood by short-haul transport. There they'll report the incident to the police.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Shelly has double-checked all the props just in case. So let's take a little break to pull ourselves together, and we'll resume shooting in the afternoon.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: That soon?
attributes.name: Staff A

attributes.content: Is there a problem?
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Cameras and film can be replaced, but we're talking about a dead man here. We've only just wiped up the blood...
attributes.name: Staff A

attributes.content: How the hell did he go looking for a prop and end up with a real knife?
attributes.name: Staff B

attributes.content: Did someone trick that washed-up drunk of an actor into looking for a lost prop himself? Or did someone put it in his hands on purpose?
attributes.name: Staff B

attributes.content: H-Hey now, let's not get carried away here.
attributes.name: Staff A

attributes.content: Sure, the old man was a drunk and late to the set all the time, but it's not like he had any enemies in the crew. Why would anyone go that far?
attributes.name: Staff A

attributes.content: Besides, it's just an ordinary knife. There are plenty of them lying around in the crew kitchen, in the convenience stores, even our own rooms...
attributes.name: Staff A

attributes.content: Maybe someone just mentioned it in passing to Dalton, and then he...
attributes.name: Staff A

attributes.content: All I'm saying is that it's suspicious, okay?
attributes.name: Staff B

attributes.content: Then why don't you ask Dalton yourself, Miss Detective?
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Look, I know you're all shocked at losing a coworker. I feel the same way. But there's something even more important we should be worrying about—
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: We don't have much time left for the shoot.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I'm sure you haven't forgotten that this studio plate is kept separate from the nomadic city.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: While it's still controlled by the central command tower, the film crew gets direct authority over certain functions, allowing us to drive it outside of central Wrankwood.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: And once the lease ends, the studio closes down, and the plate returns on its own.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: But more space means more costs. According to the contract, extending the lease will result in an expensive penalty—
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Which will be reflected in all of your paychecks.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: As the producer, it's my job to act in everyone's best interests and ensure the film crew can function.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I agree.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: So do I, as both the lead actress and investor.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Miss Detective here did remind me, though, that someone must indeed answer for this.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Prop Master?
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Y-Yes, ma'am?
attributes.name: Prop Master

attributes.content: It was your responsibility to manage the props, and you've clearly neglected it. Even your intern was on set before you.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I-I'm sorry, ma'am.
attributes.name: Prop Master

attributes.content: Apologies won't cut it, darling.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: You're fired. I suggest looking for a new job before our plate gets too far from the city... And whatever you're about to say, save it. You're getting off easy and you know it.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: You're in charge of the prop team now, Moira.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: M-Me?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Or you could leave with your former boss, but I trust you're smarter than that.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: As for you, Steven, it's time to get your act together.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: We both agree that The Death of Lady Dupont lacks a strong ending.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: You were supposed to submit the final script for those scenes last week. The shooting is almost caught up with what's written.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I have my hands full directing, okay? This crew doesn't exactly inspire confidence, you know...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: So you still haven't found the inspiration?
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: ...Yeah.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: It's your own original script, darling. Your baby. It deserves the very best ending.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: That's my biggest concern as well.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: In the end, which of the Rockefeller boys kills Lady Dupont? Where? How? What are her last words?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: The ending will determine the quality of the whole film.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: She needs a good, proper death to kickstart the revival of my career in Wrankwood.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: That's the only reason I've poured my entire fortune into this project.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: ...God will come find me.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Oh, in literary criticism we often say that inspiration is like a god descending upon the author, using him as a vessel to write about death and rebirth, destruction and hope...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Anyway, don't worry, I'll finish the story.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Good. Then you're dismissed, so get to work.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Miss Stone! Miss Stone!
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: I need to talk to you about something! It's important—
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: I know what you want to say, Shelly, but now's not the time.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I have to go check on Lucian. This is his first film, and his first day on set, and something this serious happens...
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I can't have him running away on us, now can I?
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: As for whatever you're thinking... you're overthinking it.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I... I'm in charge of the whole prop team?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Omigosh, congrats, Molly!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I mean, it's a shame about Dalton—may he rest in peace—but still, I'm happy for you.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I've been working here in Wrankwood for way longer than you, but I'm still stuck doing backgrounds, while you just got the chance of a lifetime! Life really is like a box of chocolates, huh!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: That's because you always put so much of yourself into your work. The art director isn't comfortable letting you handle more.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: But I'm just a girl from the pioneer zone who's good with her hands and came here looking for a job. Can I really do this...?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: If the producer says you can, you can! She's never wrong about people.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Your sister will be happy, won't she? You came to Wrankwood because of her, right? You gotta tell her you've been promoted to prop master!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I'll call her after we clock out. Miss Stone put her trust in me, so I have to do this right.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: That's my girl! You're already sounding the part. I bet in just a few days, you won't even have time to watch horror flicks with me anymore.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Tippi!
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Stop walking in front of me, Shelly!
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: You already checked the storyboard three times and the equipment five times. I swore to the producer that I wouldn't lose another set of cameras. Now can you stop glaring at me like that?
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: (Whispers) Do you think... it was really...?
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: What was that? Speak up.
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: Do you think Dalton's death was really just an accident? Doesn't it seem strange to you?
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: Don't know, don't care.
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: I've lost count of how many times I've had to work overtime because that has-been got lost in a beer keg. Good riddance.
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: He wasn't like that five years ago.
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: No shit, he was at the top of the world, starring in Greta and Steven's next big thing. How could I forget that when we were both there?
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: That's the weird part!
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: I saw a lot of familiar names on the staff list during the planning meetings. And when I saw your face, I got this eerie feeling, like—
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: Like we were back five years ago, witnessing that young actress's death again?
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: Doesn't it all seem a little... similar?
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: How so? One was a fall, the other was a prop mix-up.
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: You're overreacting, Shelly.
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: I'm telling you, I'm not crazy... Ah, now I remember! Dalton was the one most responsible for the accident!
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: Judgment has come... Someone came for him...
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: Just stop already! Stop scratching your arm, and stop coming up with this nonsense! I told you: if what happened still bothers you that much, get therapy and stay away from the set.
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: We're just ordinary joes shooting crappy movies for a living. Nobody gives a flip about us. Shelly? Do you hear me, Shelly?
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: I hear it... I hear it... Something's coming... coming for us...
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: Picture the position and angle of the stab in your mind.
attributes.name: ‘Whiteflower'

attributes.content: Near the bottom-right of the abdomen is a gap between vital organs, rich in blood supply, but not immediately lethal. You can feed off the blood of others, and let it herald the climax that is to come.
attributes.name: ‘Whiteflower'

attributes.content: Or, you can move the point of the knife up and penetrate the thorax.
attributes.name: ‘Whiteflower'

attributes.content: The lungs are fragile and offer no resistance. Your target will drown in both his own blood and your animated monologue.
attributes.name: ‘Whiteflower'

attributes.content: Raise your dagger, boy.
attributes.name: ‘Whiteflower'

attributes.content: Think back to the segments we've rehearsed. You've done well. There's only one step to go.
attributes.name: ‘Whiteflower'

attributes.content: Stab! Let the point of the knife know how it feels to stir the organs and sever blood vessels, and let it listen to the sound of the heart beating!
attributes.name: ‘Whiteflower'

attributes.content: Are you afraid?
attributes.name: ‘Whiteflower'

attributes.content: ...How ordinary.
attributes.name: ‘Whiteflower'

attributes.content: He's not afraid. He just doesn't understand.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: He's still not willing to practice stabbing. He hasn't spoken a single word since he took up the dagger.
attributes.name: ‘Whiteflower'

attributes.content: Go prepare for tomorrow's performance.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: ...I will instruct him myself.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: I see... Understood.
attributes.name: ‘Whiteflower'

attributes.content: Do you find the dagger heavy?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: ...Yes.
attributes.name: Young Lucian

attributes.content: But its weight does not come from the metal, nor from the ornaments. It comes from your heart. Do you understand?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: The boy's hair covers his eyes. He nods in silence.
Whiteflower does not realize that you've learned so quickly. You're waiting for her to provide answers she cannot give you.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Listen to me, child...
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: The Troupe Leader holds Lucian's little hands in his own. His smile is warm and gentle, but his iron grip permits no refusal.
Lucian can feel his stiff fingers begin to relax.
Forget the techniques that Whiteflower's been trying to teach you. You have no need to imitate any form, or any method of stabbing.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: There is no dagger without blood on it, no crossbow that is not fired. Just hold them.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: They are not props. They will tell you what to desire.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Let them guide you. Do not doubt them, even if they point you towards someone you never expected—a friend, a lover, even yourself...
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Perhaps even me, standing before you now.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: You... you?
attributes.name: Young Lucian

attributes.content: Have no hesitation. Stab.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Give it a try.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Young Lucian

attributes.content: Try it.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Young Lucian

attributes.content: Try it.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Then you, and I...
attributes.name: Young Lucian

attributes.content: What roles are we playing?
attributes.name: Young Lucian

attributes.content: If we're forgetting the techniques, then forget the characters and the script as well. They're simply the medium of theater, not theater itself.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Lucian grips the knife. The Troupe Leader lets go of his hand and kneels in front of him, so that their gazes are almost level.
But we're too close to each other...
attributes.name: Young Lucian

attributes.content: Are you afraid you'll hurt me?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: It's alright, child.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Forget even that feeling.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: You will immerse yourself in theater, and touch upon its beauty.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Gazing at the Troupe Leader, Lucian finds himself overcome with doubt. Is this really the first time he has seen the man?
He does not understand what he is saying. He begins to doubt whether the Feline before him even exists at all.
Lucian can feel his own heart throbbing.
The heartbeat never lies. The heartbeat knows the answer.
How should he ask it?
The Troupe Leader smiles, encouraging him wordlessly.
The answer is obvious.
Without hesitation, Lucian thrusts—
Did you feel it?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Lucian's hands are trembling. He feels them grow weak, almost letting go of the dagger.
The Troupe Leader has not moved an inch, not even a flicker of expression.
Lucian is certain his knife found its mark in the man's body. He heard a sound... felt the pain that should not have belonged to him, a strong, willful pain.
He had been silent since he came to the Troupe. Now, though, the pain makes him want to sing.
This is your first lesson. All stories leave behind only certain emotions, or...
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: The Troupe Leader pauses. Lucian casts a questioning glance, and meets those golden eyes.
A bond so tight that it cannot be broken.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: You're a natural actor. You should study with me.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Think about it, then come and find me... I will never be an obstacle to you, Lucian.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Lucian looks down at his hands.
The blood on his gloves has been washed away, but he remembers the feeling of taking Dalton's knife out of his hands.
Fascination, revelry.
The complex emotions he felt when he was taught to use a dagger for the first time.
Forget complicated assassination techniques. Ignite the ego with intense emotion, until all that is left is two souls tearing at one another.
Let life converge upon the knife of truth and falsehood, and bestow upon the target the perfect ending—
Death.
Come in.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Lucian.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Madam Stone.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: You look pale... are you alright?
attributes.name: Greta
